Graven et al.
17 showed that NHL CO 2 drawdown mostly happens in June and July. ESMs, however, disagree on the phase, mainly due to a premature start of the growing season (Fig.Â 3a, b). As a consequence, the CO 2 drawdown in models peaks earlier in the season. To obtain comparability for changes in CO 2 drawdown strength, we calculate the first derivative of the CO 2 concentration time series for the observational sites and each model individually. The annual minimum of the derivative in each time series reflects the months where the increase in photosynthetic CO 2 fixation is strongest (CO 2 drawdown slope). This procedure does not require a detrending of the atmospheric CO 2 signal.
